00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextLimitedPolynomial.pl - Allow only entry of polynomials.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 Implements a context in which students can only enter (expanded)
00024 polynomials (i.e., sums of multiples of powers of x).
00025 
00026 Select the context using:
00027 
00028     Context("LimitedPolynomial");
00029 
00030 If you set the "singlePowers" flag, then only one monomial of each
00031 degree can be included in the polynomial:
00032 
00033     Context("LimitedPolynomial")->flags->set(singlePowers=>1);
00034 
00035 There is also a strict limited context that does not allow
00036 operations even within the coefficients.  Select it using:
00037 
00038     Context("LimitedPolynomial-Strict");
00039 
00040 In addition to disallowing operations within the coefficients,
00041 this context does not reduce constant operations (since they are
00042 not allowed), and sets the singlePowers flag automatically.  In
00043 addition, it disables all the functions, though they can be
00044 re-enabled, if needed.
00045 
00046 
00047 Uses library module   lib/LimitedPolynomial.pm
00048 
00049 =cut
00050 
00051 loadMacros("MathObjects.pl");
00052 
00053 sub _contextLimitedPolynomial_init{
00054     Init();
00055 } # don't load it again
00056 
00057 sub Init {
00058   #
00059   #  Build the new context that calls the
00060   #  above classes rather than the usual ones
00061   #
00062 
00063   my $context = $main::context{LimitedPolynomial} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Numeric");
00064   $context->{name} = "LimitedPolynomial";
00065   $context->operators->set(
00066      '+' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::add'},
00067      '-' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::subtract'},
00068      '*' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::multiply'},
00069     '* ' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::multiply'},
00070     ' *' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::multiply'},
00071      ' ' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::multiply'},
00072      '/' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::divide'},
00073     ' /' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::divide'},
00074     '/ ' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::divide'},
00075      '^' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::power'},
00076     '**' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::BOP::power'},
00077     'u+' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::UOP::plus'},
00078     'u-' => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::UOP::minus'},
00079   );
00080   #
00081   #  Remove these operators and functions
00082   #
00083   $context->lists->set(
00084     AbsoluteValue => {class => 'LimitedPolynomial::List::AbsoluteValue'},
00085   );
00086   $context->operators->undefine('_','!','U');
00087   $context->functions->disable("atan2");
00088   #
00089   #  Hook into the numeric, trig, and hyperbolic functions
00090   #
00091   foreach ('ln','log','log10','exp','sqrt','abs','int','sgn') {
00092     $context->functions->set(
00093       "$_"=>{class => 'LimitedPolynomial::Function::numeric'}
00094     );
00095   }
00096   foreach ('sin','cos','tan','sec','csc','cot',
00097            'asin','acos','atan','asec','acsc','acot') {
00098     $context->functions->set(
00099        "$_"=>{class => 'LimitedPolynomial::Function::trig'},
00100        "${_}h"=>{class => 'LimitedPolynomial::Function::hyperbolic'}
00101     );
00102   }
00103   #
00104   #  Don't convert -ax-b to -(ax+b), or -ax+b to b-ax, etc.
00105   #
00106   $context->reduction->set("(-x)-y"=>0,"(-x)+y"=>0);
00107 
00108   #
00109   #  A context where coefficients can't include operations
00110   #
00111   $context = $main::context{"LimitedPolynomial-Strict"} = $context->copy;
00112   $context->flags->set(strictCoefficients=>1, singlePowers=>1, reduceConstants=>0);
00113   $context->functions->disable("All");  # can be re-enabled if needed
00114 
00115   main::Context("LimitedPolynomial");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly
00116 }
00117 1;
